overview: Comprehensive upgrade of project documentation using MkDocs with Material theme, providing balanced coverage for both contributors and end users.
goals: Migrate documentation to MkDocs with Material theme
Create comprehensive contributor documentation (architecture, development workflow, ADRs)
Create end-user documentation (features, getting started, guides)
Ensure 100% coverage of all key documentation areas
Implement quality gates with spelling and lint checks
nonGoals: Interactive demos or live code execution
Automated API documentation generation (manual documentation preferred)
successMetrics: All key documentation areas covered (100% coverage)
Documentation site builds successfully without errors
All spelling and lint checks pass
Content is accessible and understandable for mixed audience
uiNotes: Material theme with clean, professional design
Navigation sidebar with clear section hierarchy

importFormat.description: Migrate existing docs/ and AGENTS.md content to MkDocs format

rules: All documentation must be in Markdown format
Code examples must use proper syntax highlighting
All internal links must be relative paths
Spelling and lint checks must pass before commits

stories.title: Setup MkDocs with Material theme
stories.description: As a developer, I want MkDocs with Material theme configured so I can build and view documentation locally.
acceptanceCriteria: Install mkdocs and mkdocs-material packages
Create mkdocs.yml configuration file
Configure Material theme with default settings
Create basic index.md home page
Example: Running 'mkdocs serve' starts local dev server on http://127.0.0.1:8000
Negative case: Missing mkdocs.yml -> configuration error on build
Verify site builds successfully with 'mkdocs build'

stories.title: Configure documentation navigation structure
stories.description: As a contributor, I want clear navigation structure so I can find documentation easily.
acceptanceCriteria: Define nav structure in mkdocs.yml with all main sections
Create directory structure: docs/getting-started/, docs/user-guide/, docs/contributors/, docs/architecture/, docs/agents/, docs/adr/
Add section index files (README.md or similar)
Example: 'Getting Started' section has subpages for Installation, Configuration, First Run
Negative case: Broken navigation link -> 404 error in build
Verify navigation renders correctly in sidebar

stories.title: Create Getting Started documentation
stories.description: As a new user, I want clear getting started guides so I can quickly set up and use the WhatsApp bot.
acceptanceCriteria: Write installation guide (prerequisites, commands, verification)
Write configuration guide (environment variables, PocketBase setup)
Write first run guide (sending first message, verifying connection)
Include code examples with syntax highlighting
Example: Installation includes uv install, PocketBase download, environment setup
Negative case: Missing prerequisite causes failure in setup -> document error message and solution
Verify all commands are accurate and tested

stories.title: Create User Guide documentation
stories.description: As an end user, I want comprehensive user guides so I can understand all features and capabilities.
acceptanceCriteria: Document all available features and commands
Provide usage examples for each feature
Include common use cases and workflows
Add FAQ section for common questions
Example: 'How to create a new chore' with step-by-step instructions
Negative case: User tries unsupported command -> document error handling
Ensure language is accessible to non-technical users

stories.title: Create Contributors documentation
stories.description: As a contributor, I want development documentation so I can understand how to work on the codebase.
acceptanceCriteria: Document development workflow (setup, run, test, build)
Document code quality commands (ruff format, ruff check, ty check, pytest)
Document contribution guidelines (commit standards, PR process)
Document local development environment setup
Example: Pre-commit checklist with all required commands
Negative case: Skipping quality gates causes CI failure -> document required checks
Align with AGENTS.md instructions

stories.title: Create Architecture documentation
stories.description: As a contributor, I want architecture documentation so I understand system design and patterns.
acceptanceCriteria: Document overall system architecture and components
Document directory structure and purpose of each directory
Document engineering patterns (functional services, DTOs, dependency injection)
Document database interaction patterns (PocketBase via DatabaseService)
Document async and concurrency patterns
Example: src/services/ contains functional business logic, not service classes
Negative case: Direct PocketBase import -> document correct pattern via DatabaseService
Include diagrams using text-based format (ASCII or Mermaid if supported)

stories.title: Create Agent implementation guides
stories.description: As a developer, I want agent implementation guides so I can build or extend Pydantic AI agents.
acceptanceCriteria: Document agent naming conventions (snake_case for agents/tools, PascalCase for models)
Document dependency injection pattern with RunContext[Deps]
Document tool design patterns (single Pydantic model argument, error string returns)
Document base Deps structure in src/agents/base.py
Provide step-by-step guide for creating a new agent
Include example agent with tools
Example: 'tool_log_chore' takes LogChoreParams model, returns 'Error: Chore not found' on failure
Negative case: Raising exception in tool -> document return error string pattern instead

stories.title: Migrate ADRs to MkDocs format
stories.description: As a contributor, I want ADRs in MkDocs so all documentation is in one place.
acceptanceCriteria: Migrate existing ADRs from docs/decisions/ to docs/adr/
Convert ADRs to MkDocs Markdown format
Create ADR index page with chronological list
Maintain ADR numbering and structure
Example: ADR-017 on type checking becomes docs/adr/017-type-safety.md
Negative case: Broken internal link after migration -> verify all links work
Include ADR template for new decisions

stories.title: Migrate AGENTS.md to Contributors section
stories.description: As a contributor, I want AGENTS.md content integrated into MkDocs so all contributor docs are unified.
acceptanceCriteria: Extract content from AGENTS.md into appropriate MkDocs pages
Maintain all coding standards and conventions
Update AGENTS.md to reference the MkDocs documentation
Ensure no critical information is lost in migration
Example: 'Toolchain & Style' section goes to docs/contributors/toolchain.md
Negative case: Missing convention in MkDocs -> compare against AGENTS.md to ensure completeness
Verify internal consistency across all pages

stories.title: Add spelling and lint checks
stories.description: As a contributor, I want automated spelling and lint checks so documentation quality is maintained.
acceptanceCriteria: Install markdownlint package
Install textlint package
Configure markdownlint rules for Markdown files
Configure textlint rules for spelling and grammar
Add quality gate commands to pyproject.toml or similar
Example: 'uv run markdownlint docs/' catches formatting issues
Negative case: Typo in documentation -> textlint catches spelling error
Document quality gate commands in Contributors guide

stories.title: Verify documentation builds successfully
stories.description: As a contributor, I want documentation that builds without errors so it can be reliably viewed.
acceptanceCriteria: Run 'mkdocs build' and verify no errors or warnings
Verify all internal links resolve correctly (no 404s)
Verify all external links are accessible
Check that navigation renders completely
Verify search functionality works
Example: Complete build generates site/ directory with all pages
Negative case: Broken internal link -> build error or 404 on navigation
Test local server with 'mkdocs serve' and browse all pages

stories.title: Create README with documentation link
stories.description: As a new user or contributor, I want clear direction to the documentation so I can find what I need.
acceptanceCriteria: Update project README with clear link to documentation
Add instructions for building documentation locally
Include quick links to key sections (Getting Started, Contributors)
Example: 'For full documentation, run `mkdocs serve` and visit http://127.0.0.1:8000'
Negative case: Outdated link -> broken link in README
Keep README concise with reference to full docs
